Description: Three small fragments of a well-spun dark brown wool loin-cloth (?), used possibly as wrapping. The thread count is warp 12 per 10mm and weft 14 per 10mm. The spinning direction of warp and weft is 's'. The weave is plain and weft-predominant. The selvedge is reinforced with 3 warp cords. All the fragments were originally joined. One of the textile fragments is tied in a knot, while the other is its continuing part of a strap. A small group of dark orange coloured cotton yarns placed in the middle of the knot, possibly its cord. The object might have been a pom-pom tassel of wrapping cloth.
Bibliographic references: Adams et al 1999 / Kulubnarti III: The Cemeteries (p. 60, 65)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 93.1.207A, B (excavation object cat. no.)
